skill.name: code-context-finder
skill.description: Automatically find relevant context from knowledge graph and code relationships while coding. Detects when context would be helpful (new files, unfamiliar code, architectural decisions) and surfaces related entities, prior decisions, and code dependencies.
skill.summary: Automatically find relevant context from knowledge graph and code relationships while coding. Detect...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with accompanying Python CLI script. The script safely reads Python files within specified directories to analyze code relationships. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution risks detected. Capabilities align with stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Developers often lose context when working with unfamiliar code or making changes. This skill automatically detects when context would help and surfaces relevant knowledge graph entries, code relationships, dependencies, and tests.
actual_capabilities: Detect when code context would help (new files, refactoring, debugging)
Search knowledge graph for related entities and prior decisions
Find files that import or depend on a target module
Locate function callers and class usage patterns
Discover related test files for any module
limitations: Only analyzes Python files (other languages via grep patterns in documentation)
Does not write to knowledge graph (user must update manually)
Requires MCP memory server for knowledge graph features
Works within specified root directory only

use_cases.title: Onboarding with context
use_cases.description: Understand unfamiliar code by seeing related entities, decisions, and dependencies before making changes.

use_cases.title: Safe refactoring
use_cases.description: Find all callers and dependents before changing shared modules to avoid breaking downstream code.

use_cases.title: Error investigation
use_cases.description: Trace error patterns through related components using knowledge graph and code relationships.

prompt_templates.title: Quick context check
prompt_templates.prompt: Find context for the file I am working on. Check the knowledge graph for related entities and find all files that import this module.

prompt_templates.title: Impact analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all callers, dependents, and tests for [module_name]. What will break if I change this?

prompt_templates.title: Debugging help
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the knowledge graph for similar errors or past issues. Find the code path to the affected component.

prompt_templates.title: Architectural review
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all architectural decisions related to [feature]. What patterns were established and why?

output_examples.input: Find context for the auth_service module
output: Knowledge Graph: 3 entities found (auth_decision, user_session, security_pattern)
Related Decision: Use JWT for session tokens (ADR-2024-001)

best_practices: Run context check before modifying any shared or core module
Update the knowledge graph when making architectural decisions
Review test coverage before refactoring to ensure safety
anti_patterns: Making changes without checking for dependent files first
Ignoring prior architectural decisions documented in knowledge graph
Modifying code without verifying test coverage exists

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires MCP memory server for knowledge graph features.

faq.question: What file types can it analyze?
faq.answer: The Python script analyzes Python files. The documentation includes grep patterns for TypeScript and JavaScript.

faq.question: Does it modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads files and outputs information. It does not write to any files.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis runs locally. Code is read only and never sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is nothing being found?
faq.answer: Ensure you are in the project root directory. Check that MCP memory server is running for knowledge graph queries.

faq.question: How is this different from grep?
faq.answer: Combines grep-like search with knowledge graph context, automatically surfacing related decisions and tests.
